occurrences.text: Begin to think about the faith of Joseph, and a life that's marked by faith. We see it in these statements, and he believed that God would do what God said he would do. He believed that God had promised to Abraham, and to Isaac, and to Jacob a land. He believed, even as God had shared with Jacob in chapter 46, before Jacob would leave that land and go to Egypt, that God said to Jacob, I am God, the God of thy father, fear not to go down into Egypt, for I will there make of thee a great nation, and I will go down with thee into Egypt, and I will also surely bring thee up again, and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes. Genesis 46, three and four. And Joseph believed that. Joseph did not live long enough to see it come to pass, but his eye of faith, he says in verse number 24, and again in verse 25, notice he says, God will surely visit you. I mean, confident faith, expecting that God will do what God said he will do. Not only was he convinced that God would visit and bring the nation into the land that he promised, but he says in verse number 25 that he took an oath of them, saying, carry up my bones from hence. You know, it's not until Joshua chapter 24 that we read of that being fulfilled, and
occurrences.context: ...o Egypt, and I will also surely bring thee up again, and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes. Genesis 46, three and four. And Joseph believed that. Joseph did not live long enough to see it come to pass, ...
